codeSystems.name: SNOMEDMyelodysplasticDiseasesVS
codeSystems.title: SNOMED Myelodysplastic Diseases
codeSystems.description: The myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) are a group of clonal hematopoietic stem cell diseases characterized by cytopenia(s), dysplasia (abnormal growth or development leading to an alteration in size, shape, and organization of the cell) in one or more of the major myeloid cell lines (WBC, RBC, and/or platelets), ineffective hematopoiesis, and an increased risk of developing acute myelogenous leukemia (AML). MDS occurs primarily in older adults, with a median age of 70 years. The majority of recipients present with symptoms related to cytopenias. Most recipients present with anemia requiring RBC transfusions.

codeSystems.name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Interpretation Codes
codeSystems.description:
A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.   
   
   Notes:
   
   This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-cibmtr-obs-priority-: CIBMTR Observation Laboratory Results: Priority Variables

codeSystems.name: LanguageCodesWithLanguageAndOptionallyARegionModifier
codeSystems.title: Language codes with language and optionally a region modifier
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes from [BCP-47](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). This value set matches the ONC 2015 Edition LanguageCommunication data element value set within C-CDA to use a 2 character language code if one exists,   and a 3 character code if a 2 character code does not exist. It points back to [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646), however only the language codes are required, all other elements are optional.

codeSystems.name: CancerDisorderVS
codeSystems.title: Cancer Disorder Value Set
codeSystems.description: A broad cancer-related value set containing both primary and secondary tumor types, with codes from ICD-10 and SNOMED CT, including both diagnosis and histology/morphology/behavior codes. ICD-O-3 morphology codes may also be used and are considered conformant to the specification. For SNOMED, the value set includes all codes descending from 363346000 'Malignant neoplastic disease (disorder)' and 108369006 'Neoplasm (morphologic abnormality)'.

codeSystems.name: DNAChangeTypeVS
codeSystems.title: DNA Change Type
codeSystems.description: DNA Change Type of a variant.

codeSystems.name: HGNCVS
codeSystems.title: HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee Gene Names (HGNC)
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all HGNC Codes, which includes multiple code systems. In this guide, Gene IDs from HGNC are used as CodeableConcepts, which must be sent with the HGNC gene ID including the prefix 'HGNC:' as the code and the HGNC 'gene symbol' as display. CAUTION: HGNC also indexes gene groups by numeric ID (without a prefix), and older systems may send HGNC gene IDs without the prefix, so care must be taken to confirm alignment. We have separately included the genegroup code system to draw attention to this ambiguity and potential error.

codeSystems.name: HGVSVS
codeSystems.title: Human Genome Variation Society (HGVS) Nomenclature
codeSystems.description: HGVS-nomenclature is used to report and exchange information regarding variants found in DNA, RNA and protein sequences and serves as an international standard. (source: varnomen.hgvs.org)

codeSystems.name: MolecularConsequenceVS
codeSystems.title: Molecular Consequence
codeSystems.description: The calculated or observed effect of a variant on its downstream transcript and, if applicable, ensuing protein sequence.

codeSystems.name: VariantConfidenceStatusVS
codeSystems.title: Variant Confidence Status
codeSystems.description: A code that classifies the confidence for calling this variant.

codeSystems.name: VariantInheritanceVS
codeSystems.title: Variant Inheritances
codeSystems.description: By which parent the variant was inherited in the patient, if known.
